page.title: 13Fairy Steps Beetham
page.content: The Fairy Steps is a well known place where lots of tourists go. The steps were cut in the rock of Whin Scar many centuries ago. About two hundred years ago the people of Storth travelled to Beetham where there was one shop .They went via Fairy Steps . There was an iron ring in the rock face nearby and to it a rope was attached for lowering sacks of flour and parcels on the return journey. There is a fantastic view from the top. You can see Morcambe Bay, the viaduct at Arnside and Grange over Sands.It is a popular picnic area. At one side of the steps is a deep, narrow crevice in the limestone which is called The Witches Chimney.Children love to climb down.
